content: here's another super thrifty
scratch-build model for your sci-fi wargames I use mine when I'm playing
grim dark future it's more complex build if you're into those is the template
you'll need to download so let's get to it
first off download the template from the
link in the description below since it has all the dimensions in it I'm not
going to belabor them in the narration go ahead and cut out the main body from
double corrugated cardboard and apply corrugation cladding then cut out the
firewall from single corrugated cardboard and apply corrugation cladding
and hot glue the main body to it perpendicularly as you see here
take some extruded polystyrene foam
board and cut out the front of the speeder start by cutting a rectangular
block then angling both short ends and finally chamfering the whole thing along
the long side now trace the engine bay on to cereal box cut it out and assemble
it be sure to lightly score with your knife along the red lines to make a nice
clean fold and remember to keep the unfinished side out because it takes
paint much better attach it to the firewall such that the tops are flush
then cut out the rear wrap again from cereal box and attach it to the engine
bay set about a centimeter back from the firewall I rated my old Lego collection
and found these two gears hot glued them to the back as the exhaust
again with cereal box cut out and attach the rear spoiler and the mid spoiler you
may wish to attach these with super glue instead of hot glue to avoid that ugly
line then from sturdy chipboard cut out to wings and attach them to the back at
about a 45 degree angle lastly is the divider use chipboard or a corrugated
cardboard whatever you like and secure it to the middle of the cockpit again
here's one of those champagne flute bottoms that 60 millimeters that we've
used several times before hot glue it to the bottom as for the weapons I did two
machine guns took some kebab skewers and chopped short segments hot gluing seven
of them together in a cluster like this and wrap some thin cardstock around the
ends these get attached exactly as we did back in episode 61 for the alien
Graff tank and one more detail cut some quarter-inch wide strips of paper or
thin cardstock and wrap them around the front like this
so black vomit blue vomit and paint it up to match your army I use the exact
same painting methods as we use back in episode 58 for the tank and before we go
to the table I'd like to take a moment to thank all wcv sponsors this week I
draw your attention to hero's hoard which is an excellent resource for 3d
printed scenery including but not limited to Altru tiles products so if
you're into 3d printing even if it's just to supplement your conventional
crafting it is worth a click to check it out and see what's what and here it is
in context ready to rock again I made some stickers using the method from
episode 9 except of course that these are only one-sided and I attach them
with a glue stick also step 2 paper minis in the cockpit again see episode 9
I am why lock thank you for joining me and I'll see you next time
